first_reading.text:
[[Ac 6,1]]As the number of disciples continued to grow,  the Hellenists complained against the Hebrews  because their widows  were being neglected in the daily distribution.
[[Ac 6,2]]So the Twelve called together the community of the disciples and said, "It is not right for us to neglect the word of God to serve at table.
[[Ac 6,3]]Brothers, select from among you seven reputable men, filled with the Spirit and wisdom, whom we shall appoint to this task,
[[Ac 6,4]]whereas we shall devote ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word."
[[Ac 6,5]]The proposal was acceptable to the whole community, so they chose Stephen, a man filled with faith and the holy Spirit, also Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicholas of Antioch, a convert to Judaism.
[[Ac 6,6]]They presented these men to the apostles who prayed and laid hands on them.
[[Ac 6,7]]The word of God continued to spread, and the number of the disciples in Jerusalem increased greatly; even a large group of priests were becoming obedient to the faith.
first_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 33,1]]Exult, you just, in the LORD; 
Praise from the upright is fitting.
[[Ps 33,2]]Give thanks to the LORD on the harp; 
With the ten stringed lyre chant his praises

[[Ps 33,4]]For upright is the word of the LORD, 
and all his works are trustworthy.
[[Ps 33,5]]He loves justice and right; 
of the kindness of the LORD the earth is full.

[[Ps 33,18]]See, the eyes of the LORD are upon those who fear him, 
upon those who hope for his kindness,
[[Ps 33,19]]To deliver them from death 
and preserve them in spite of famine.

second_reading.title: First Letter of Peter
second_reading.text:
[[1_P 2,4]]Come to him, a living stone, rejected by human beings but chosen and precious in the sight of God,
[[1_P 2,5]]and, like living stones, let yourselves be built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood to offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
[[1_P 2,6]]For it says in scripture: "Behold, I am laying a stone in Zion, a cornerstone, chosen and precious, and whoever believes in it shall not be put to shame."
[[1_P 2,7]]Therefore, its value is for you who have faith, but for those without faith: "The stone which the builders rejected has become the cornerstone,"
[[1_P 2,8]]and "A stone that will make people stumble, and a rock that will make them fall." They stumble by disobeying the word, as is their destiny.
[[1_P 2,9]]But you are "a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people of his own, so that you may announce the praises" of him who called you out of darkness into his wonderful light.

gospel.text:
[[Jn 14,1]]Jesus said to his disciples:  "Do not let your hearts be troubled.  You have faith in God; have faith also in me.
[[Jn 14,2]]In my Father's house there are many dwelling places. If there were not, would I have told you that I am going to prepare a place for you?
[[Jn 14,3]]And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come back again and take you to myself, so that where I am you also may be.
[[Jn 14,4]]Where (I) am going you know the way."
[[Jn 14,5]]Thomas said to him, "Master, we do not know where you are going; how can we know the way?"
[[Jn 14,6]]Jesus said to him, "I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me."
[[Jn 14,7]]If you know me, then you will also know my Father. From now on you do know him and have seen him."
[[Jn 14,8]]Philip said to him, "Master, show us the Father, and that will be enough for us."
[[Jn 14,9]]Jesus said to him, "Have I been with you for so long a time and you still do not know me, Philip? Whoever has seen me has seen the Father. How can you say, 'Show us the Father'?
[[Jn 14,10]]Do you not believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words that I speak to you I do not speak on my own. The Father who dwells in me is doing his works.
[[Jn 14,11]]Believe me that I am in the Father and the Father is in me, or else, believe because of the works themselves.
[[Jn 14,12]]Amen, amen, I say to you, whoever believes in me will do the works that I do, and will do greater ones than these, because I am going to the Father.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
